item.title: HTML Example
item.subtitle: This uses JavaScript, too!
item.description:
There are all kinds of super fun things you can do with HTML in your XML files.

You can use http://jsbin.com to preview your HTML. Wrap your HTML markup in a CDATA block

HTML

You can add links to your app. For instance, you can add a link to order Dominos pizza. If you leave default settings on, the website will open within the app. If you want to link to websites within your app but have them open up in the user's browser, you can add target="_blank" to your anchor tags and change the AppSettings.cs file to allow for it. By default, it is disabled.

Or you could just call them at (713) 747-3800. This will initiate a phone call in WP8 or Windows 8 via Skype or other phone apps.

Add images to your pages.

You might want to list things.

  • Item 1
  • Item 2

You can add a table. And center it using inline CSS.

Column 1 Column 2
Row 1 abcde
Row 2 fghij

You can also style things with a style block.

This div has a class of 'example'.

JavaScript

Yes, you can even run JavaScript from within this WebView.

Hey, what day is it??

iframes

Want to embed another webpage in your app? You can do that using an iframe!

...and this is just the beginning.

What else can you think of to do?
